intro: Psychotria noumeensis, commonly known as the New Caledonia Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of the region. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
